summary: This FBI 302 report documents an interview with a Bureau of Prisons Senior Officer Specialist regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019. The officer describes his role during the morning watch shift, the response to the body alarm, and the transportation of Epstein to the hospital.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: A body alarm sounded at approximately 6:33 AM in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York. Responding officers found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive. Medical personnel performed CPR, and he was transported to the hospital.

events.title: Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: A Senior Officer Specialist from the Bureau of Prisons was interviewed by FBI, OIG, and SDNY officials regarding the events surrounding Epstein's death on August 10, 2019.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, New York
United States Attorneys Office (USAO), Southern District of New York (SDNY), 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
keyFacts: The interview was conducted in lieu of an appearance before the Federal Grand Jury and was voluntary.
On August 10, 2019, a body alarm for Jeffrey Epstein sounded at approximately 6:33 AM in the Special Housing Unit.
Epstein was found 'loose' and had to be put in restraints before transport to the hospital, though he showed no movement on his own.
The interviewed BOP officer wrote a memo about the incident, as required when responding to a body alarm.
The officer stated he had no prior interactions with Jeffrey Epstein before his death.
